file_content.text: I must ask you not to speak; this encryption is sender-side only. I'm Gyden Kall, a senior investigator in Darth Marr's service.
Let me be frank. I think the Chevin Conglomerate has sponsored this scavenger hunt as a ruse, to hide some greater plan.
There's a way to find out. Several Chevin are camped nearby; the listening device on this transmitter, once planted, will pick up their conversation.
Help place the device, and I'll help you gather the items on your list. Best not to let anyone else find them. Kall out.
A signal at last; the Empire's jammers are not simple to overcome. Report.
Sirs, please. I'm monitoring every interstellar sensor from here to the Cholganna system--there's no sign yet.
When the fleet could arrive at any moment, your statement is not acceptable. Preparations must be made.
A fleet? A Chevin fleet, perhaps? We need to know more--if you're amenable.
There's a man here, Fallaxen, who works as a courier for the Chevin. Perhaps you could... persuade him to part with any information he has? We can speak later.
Gyden Kall, reporting in. I have Fallaxen's data; it makes for fascinating reading.
Apparently, several Chevin High Acquisitors are meeting on Nar Shaddaa, in secret. Perhaps they think the Smuggler's Moon is safe from spies.
If you could observe that meeting, unseen, we might have the answers we need. Notify me when you're in position, and I'll be in touch.
The Grand Acquisitions Race is competitive commerce which enriches your citizens. The SIS has no grounds to interfere.
That bantha-pat wouldn't fool a trainee, and it doesn't fool me. Be seeing you.
He blusters to no profit. But the ideograms were traded; the time of greatest opportunity approaches.
Intriguing. The Republic is also investigating. But I have something I can look into: these "ideograms" the Chevin mentioned.
Please; whatever their promises, the Chevin Conglomerate cannot be allowed to have the items they seek. They must stay in Imperial hands.
If you obtain them, place the items at these coordinates. I must return to work; I'll contact you with my findings.
